New Records: Glenn Maxwell scored the fastest Twenty20 international century on Australian soil
Glenn Maxwell equalled Indian great Rohit Sharma with the most T20I centuries — five
Key Match Events: Australia won the match by 34 runs
Maxwell reached his century from just 50 balls
The West Indies were never in the hunt after losing five wickets inside their initial seven overs
Post-Match Reflections: It's nice to cash in and spend most of the time out there,When it (the ball) is not doing too much, you're thinking … that you have actually got to make the most of this opportunity,You don't get too many in T20 cricket when you have got a couple of short square boundaries and the wicket is just really nice and true and you have given yourself a good platform,So I was just trying to stick it out there for as long as I could,I have always relied on my hand speed to get me out of trouble if my footwork is a little bit slow,So I was just trying to give myself the best chance to use my hands to guide into a gap or get it over the in-field and it really seemed to work for me.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Australia's total was the nation's fourth-highest in a T20I
The benchmark is 3-263 against Sri Lanka in Pallekele in 2016 when Maxwell made his career-best 145 not out
Left-arm quick Spencer Johnson replaced Sean Abbott who has also been ruled out of Tuesday's series finale because of a shoulder injury
Others: Australia took an unassailable 2-0 lead in the best-of-three series
Glenn Maxwell reached his half-century from 25 balls
